author: Aaron Flanagan
title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Real Madrid forward Mariano Diaz to reject Reds move?
text:
Mariano is expected to remain at Real Madrid (Photo: Getty) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool have made an offer for Real Madrid forward Mariano Diaz, according to Cadena Ser. 
It is believed that the Reds are competing against Deportivo Alaves for his signature - but the player does not want to leave the Bernabeu. 
Mariano has reportedly told Real chiefs that he wants to remain at the club for the foreseeable future. 
The 23-year-old, who is a Dominican Republic international, has also allegedly been touted as a potential signing for Everton. 
Mariano has largely only been used in cup competitions by Real this season, making only three La Liga appearances. Sakho in talks with Crystal Palace Sakho could be on his way out of Anfield for good (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty Images) 
Crystal Palace boss Sam Allardyce has talked to Liverpool about out-of-favour defender Mamadou Sakho , writes Mirror Football's Darren Lewis. 
But there are huge obstacles to overcome because of the £20million price tag and his big wages which would be a problem for Palace's wage structure. 
Liverpool want a permanent deal but Palace not close on agreement. 
The £16million defender was sent home from the club’s pre-season tour of America and had previously infuriated club officials by taking a fat-burner which subsequently saw him miss the end of last season. Liverpool miss out on Inter wonderkid Liverpool have missed out on Pinamonti's signature (Photo: Getty) 
Liverpool have missed out on Inter Milan wonderkid Andrea Pinamonti, writes Mirror Football's John Cross. 
The 17-year-old was a target for Liverpool and Juventus amid a contract stand off but he is now expected to stay at Inter. 
His prolific form for the primavera side, scoring 16 goals in 18 games, earned him a first team debut in the Europa League this season. 
Able to link with the midfield and work the channels, Pinamonti moves similarly to Fernando Torres during his time at Anfield. Mane ready to return for Chelsea clash Mane is set to be utilised by Liverpool once again (Photo: Liverpool FC/Getty Images) 
Jurgen Klopp will decide on Sadio Mane's participation against Chelsea only after he “looks into his eyes”, writes Mirror Football's David Maddock. 
Liverpool put on a private jet to fly the Senegal international back from the Africa Cup of Nations, following his nation's exit from the tournament on penalties at the quarter final stage. 
But Reds boss Klopp revealed there was a problem with the winger being allowed on the plane in Gabon, which means he will arrive back in England tonight, before training tomorrow morning.
